trans-unit.source: If you encounter errors after submitting your app to the Store, you must resolve them in order to continue the certification process.
trans-unit.target: If you encounter errors after submitting your app to the Store, you must resolve them in order to continue the certification process.

trans-unit.source: Resolve submission errors
trans-unit.target: Resolve submission errors

trans-unit.source: Resolve submission errors
trans-unit.target: Resolve submission errors

trans-unit.source: If you encounter errors after submitting your app to the Store, you must resolve them in order to continue the [certification process](the-app-certification-process.md).
trans-unit.target: If you encounter errors after submitting your app to the Store, you must resolve them in order to continue the [certification process](the-app-certification-process.md).

trans-unit.source: The error message will indicate what the problem is and what you might need to do in order to fix the issue.
trans-unit.target: The error message will indicate what the problem is and what you might need to do in order to fix the issue.

trans-unit.source: Here is some additional info that can help you resolve these errors.
trans-unit.target: Here is some additional info that can help you resolve these errors.

trans-unit.source: UWP apps
trans-unit.target: UWP apps

trans-unit.source: If you are submitting a UWP app, you may see an error during preprocessing if your package file is not an .appxupload file generated by Visual Studio for the Store.
trans-unit.target: If you are submitting a UWP app, you may see an error during preprocessing if your package file is not an .appxupload file generated by Visual Studio for the Store.

trans-unit.source: Be sure that you follow the steps in [Packaging Universal Windows apps for Windows 10](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=620193 ) when creating your app's package file, and only upload the .appxupload file on the [Packages](upload-app-packages.md) page of the submission, not an appx or .appxbundle.
trans-unit.target: Be sure that you follow the steps in [Packaging Universal Windows apps for Windows 10](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=620193 ) when creating your app's package file, and only upload the .appxupload file on the [Packages](upload-app-packages.md) page of the submission, not an appx or .appxbundle.

trans-unit.source: If a compilation error is displayed, make sure that you are able to build your application in Release mode successfully.
trans-unit.target: If a compilation error is displayed, make sure that you are able to build your application in Release mode successfully.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [.NET Native Internal Compiler Errors](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=613098).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [.NET Native Internal Compiler Errors](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=613098).

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone apps
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone apps

trans-unit.source: You may see **error 2001** when problems with Windows Phone packages are detected during preprocessing.
trans-unit.target: You may see **error 2001** when problems with Windows Phone packages are detected during preprocessing.

trans-unit.source: In most cases, you will need to rebuild your app's package to correct the error.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, you will need to rebuild your app's package to correct the error.

trans-unit.source: Once you've done that, replace the old package with the new one on the [Packages](upload-app-packages.md) page of the submission before you click **Submit to the Store** again.
trans-unit.target: Once you've done that, replace the old package with the new one on the [Packages](upload-app-packages.md) page of the submission before you click **Submit to the Store** again.

trans-unit.source: There are a number of issues that may cause this error.
trans-unit.target: There are a number of issues that may cause this error.

trans-unit.source: Review the list below to determine which might apply to your packages.
trans-unit.target: Review the list below to determine which might apply to your packages.

trans-unit.source: **One or more assemblies in the package are obfuscated incorrectly:** Use a different tool to perform the obfuscation, or remove the obfuscation.
trans-unit.target: **One or more assemblies in the package are obfuscated incorrectly:** Use a different tool to perform the obfuscation, or remove the obfuscation.

trans-unit.source: The compile process optimizes the obfuscated assemblies, but occasionally some assemblies are obfuscated using a tool that modifies the MSIL in an unsupported way that will cause an error.
trans-unit.target: The compile process optimizes the obfuscated assemblies, but occasionally some assemblies are obfuscated using a tool that modifies the MSIL in an unsupported way that will cause an error.

trans-unit.source: **The size of one or more methods in the app exceeds 256 KB of IL:** Refactor the offending method into smaller functions.
trans-unit.target: **The size of one or more methods in the app exceeds 256 KB of IL:** Refactor the offending method into smaller functions.

trans-unit.source: The size of MSIL for methods in an assembly can be determined by using the ILDASM tool.
trans-unit.target: The size of MSIL for methods in an assembly can be determined by using the ILDASM tool.

trans-unit.source: **The strong name signature validation failed for one or more assemblies:** This error typically occurs when the strong name signing was performed using a key different than the one expected in the assembly metadata.
trans-unit.target: **The strong name signature validation failed for one or more assemblies:** This error typically occurs when the strong name signing was performed using a key different than the one expected in the assembly metadata.

trans-unit.source: Sign with the correct key, or remove strong name signing.
trans-unit.target: Sign with the correct key, or remove strong name signing.

trans-unit.source: **The package contains mixed-mode (with managed and native code) assemblies:** Mixed-mode assemblies are not supported on Windows Phone.
trans-unit.target: **The package contains mixed-mode (with managed and native code) assemblies:** Mixed-mode assemblies are not supported on Windows Phone.

trans-unit.source: Remove the mixed-mode assemblies from the package and resubmit the app.
trans-unit.target: Remove the mixed-mode assemblies from the package and resubmit the app.

trans-unit.source: **A Windows Phone 8.1 XAP or appx/appxbundle assembly is not valid:** Make sure your .winmd file has at least one public entry point.
trans-unit.target: **A Windows Phone 8.1 XAP or appx/appxbundle assembly is not valid:** Make sure your .winmd file has at least one public entry point.

trans-unit.source: You can use any decompiler application to review the code and check for public entry points if needed.
trans-unit.target: You can use any decompiler application to review the code and check for public entry points if needed.

trans-unit.source: Another error that you might see after submitting your app is **error 1300**.
trans-unit.target: Another error that you might see after submitting your app is **error 1300**.

trans-unit.source: This occurs when one or more assemblies (or the entire package) is already precompiled.
trans-unit.target: This occurs when one or more assemblies (or the entire package) is already precompiled.

trans-unit.source: To fix this issue, rebuild the app's package in Microsoft Visual Studio and then submit the newly-generated package.
trans-unit.target: To fix this issue, rebuild the app's package in Microsoft Visual Studio and then submit the newly-generated package.
